containers.vector



struct Vector(T);
Simple dynamic array with manually managed memory, similar to C++ vector.

Only bare requirements are implemented. Can be improved if needed.

Vector opCall();
Construct an empty vector.

void die();
Destroy the vector.

int opApply(int delegate(ref T) dg);
Used by foreach.

void opCatAssign(T element);
Append an element to the vector.

T opIndex(uint index);
Get element at the specified index.

Index must not be out of bounds.

Params:
uint index Index of the element to get.

Returns:
Element at the specified index.

void opIndexAssign(T value, uint index);
Set element at the specified index.

Index must not be out of bounds.

Params:
uint index Index of the element to set.

T* ptr(uint index);
Get a pointer to element at the specified index.

Index must not be out of bounds.

Params:
uint index Index of the element to get.

Returns:
Pointer to the element at the specified index.

T[] array();
Access vector contents as an array.

void remove(T element, bool ident = false);
Remove element from the vector.

If more elements match specified element, all of them will be removed.

Params:
T element Element to remove.
bool ident Remove exactly specified element (i.e. is element) instead of just anything equal to element (== element).

void remove(bool delegate(ref T) deleg);
Remove elements from vector according to a function.

Params:
bool delegate(ref T) deleg Function determining whether to remove an element. Any element for which deleg returns true is removed.

void remove_at_index(uint index);
Remove element at specified index.

Must be within bounds.

Params:
uint index Index to remove at.

bool contains(T element, bool ident = false);
Determine whether or not the vector contains specified element.

Params:
T element Element to look for.
bool ident Look exactly for specified element (i.e. is element) instead of just anything equal to element (== element).

Returns:
True if the vector contains the element, false otherwise.

uint length();
Get number of elements in the vector.

void length(uint length);
Change length of the vector.

If the length will be lower than current length, trailing elements will be erased. If higher, the vector will be expanded.

Params:
uint length length to set.
